Someone leaked half of the RSA private key during a shady ICO. Can you recover the key and decrypt the founder’s lost message? Ciphertext: 2140669140745439400101054329389848549458820848761165498427537799761007660001443557888874893753850667733573485213819199282677391715097021265658777688984056

The flag format is flag{...}
n=6173316178537499484870393946425693733428528683602348287112144527403479338214175636124477497259491615139842773840362865552845841453404990672526753495885569, e=1107137398946130196598277285399371676594456980275187867180018612022359990327033137618481765279487142656418145238330573027171423889688465726409957594740477, partial_p=14913043504812453257

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{butwm9so}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 2140669140745439400101054329389848549458820848761165498427537799761007660001443557888874893753850667733573485213819199282677391715097021265658777688984056
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=6173316178537499484870393946425693733428528683602348287112144527403479338214175636124477497259491615139842773840362865552845841453404990672526753495885569, e=1107137398946130196598277285399371676594456980275187867180018612022359990327033137618481765279487142656418145238330573027171423889688465726409957594740477, partial_p=14913043504812453257
extra_info: p=93610691263955318246502947959452363375282393397586814925300446287905630376149, q=65946700052994131675362326901963912609850814352107984119088846389862190707581, φ(n)=6173316178537499484870393946425693733428528683602348287112144527403479338214016078733160547809569749864981357564377732345096146654360601379848985674801840
